name: Yucca House National Monument
description: Yucca House National Monument preserves a large unexcavated pueblo with a stunning setting in Montezuma Valley, nestled between Mesa Verde and Ute Mountain. Since Yucca House was protected as a national monument in 1919, it has remained largely untouched, offering intrepid visitors a sense of discovery and preserving the pueblo's beauty and integrity for future generations.
shortDescription: Yucca House National Monument preserves a large unexcavated pueblo with a stunning setting in Montezuma Valley, nestled between Mesa Verde and Ute Mountain. Since Yucca House was protected as a nation...

operatingHours.description: Open year-round, weather pending. No services are available.

climate.weatherDescription: Spring and Fall are mild with daytime temperatures ranging from 50 F to 80 F. Winter temperatures are below 50 F with occasional snowstorms. Summers are hot and dry, with highs in the 90s.

images.title: Yucca House Spring
images.caption: Cattails define marshy locations watered by springs.

images.title: View of Mesa Verde from Yucca House
images.caption: View of Mesa Verde above from Yucca House in the valley below.

images.title: Walls of the Yucca House Pueblo
images.caption: Ancient walls of Yucca House still standing today.

images.caption: View of an Ancestral Puebloan wall still standing at Yucca House.

images.title: Yucca House in Context
images.altText: View of  ancient wall in the center of agricultural land surrounding it.
images.caption: The Yucca House archeological site is surrounded by agricultural land today.
